item.title: Basics Of Pointers
item.description: A pointer is a special type of variable that can hold the memory address of an another variable. Overview of C++ Pointers 1. Accessing address of a variable We can access the memory address of a variable by & symbol int x = 10; &x // gives the memory address Example #include <iostream> int main() { int mark = 300; int age = 24; int salary = 17000; std::cout << "Address of mark: "<< &mark << std::endl; std::cout << "Address of age: " << &age << std::endl; std::cout << "Address of salary: " << &salary << std::endl; } 2.
